alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 10:05PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...The Flood Advisory is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Chocolay River near Harvey affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall continue. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas of Peter Nordeen Park begin to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:25 PM EDT Monday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 6.9 feet early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1115 PM EDT /1015 PM CDT/.
